Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heya there. What are you guys talking so seriously about?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: This is a serious matter indeed…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Right. This issue has to be settled now.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: We’re in so much trouble!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Just tell me what’s going on.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Netzach ran off!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The Floor of Art was responsible for cleaning the Library’s corridors this week.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wha?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Do you have any guesses on where he might be?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nah, of course not. No way. Hmhm…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: His assistant librarians must’ve all disappeared with him, too…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Cleaning? I don’t remember ordering you to clean this place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We’ve concluded that while each librarian should clean their own rooms, it’s better to take turns to clean the corridors as they’re public spaces used by all of us.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You lot always love to cause a bigger fuss than necessary, don’t you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Do you want us to stop it?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No, I don’t mind it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Thank goodness…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Anyway, that’s why we’ve been wondering! Just where did Netzach hide away!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Alright, here’s Netzach.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: W…what the… What happened…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It takes no effort for me to locate and relocate you lot, wherever in this Library you may be.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Netzaaaach~! We promised to keep the order we decided on!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: You’re so mean, running away when it’s your turn…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You reek of alcohol, and so do your assistant librarians behind you…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: …I can explain, there’s a good explanation for this.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: What explanation?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Let’s hear your story, then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Now now, Netzach will surely be careful next time. That’s enough scolding.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: No. I must hear what he has to say.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Netzaaaaaach!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: …Look, I didn’t feel like cleaning, but I still was gonna do it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: I was grumbling to myself about it, then Roland came along and said he found a good spot to goof off…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Says he’ll tell me where if I shared some of my beer, and how I can skip clea— Mh, mmh!!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa, looks like he’s still too drunk to speak straight.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He sure loves to drink for someone so weak with it. Hahaha…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: …Roland. Is what Netzach said true?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Haha… Naw, can’t be.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I can faintly smell alcohol from you as well, now that Netzach’s confessed it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I’m disappointed in you two!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, I’m sorry! I’ll help Netzach clean the corridors today, so please forgive me!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Hm, no. How about you join them on the cleaning roster from now on, rather than just for today?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whaat?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: That’s a good idea.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I could forgive your misbehavior today in that case.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Good luck with the cleaning, then!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: …You’re also prone to make a fuss, aren’t you, Roland.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hunh.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Social Sciences

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Put that wily face outta my sight.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: C’mon~ You’re acting up again.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Bah… I liked you a lot better when you were just a box of steel.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Wow, really? I guess today is my lucky day, getting compliments from Gebura of all people~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Huh? That wasn’t supposed to be a compliment, you…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Alright, cut it out, you two. Aren’t you sick of fighting already?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …This teal-haired turd keeps rubbing coffee in my face.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I don’t get what’s so good about a cup of bitter bean water.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s an acquired taste, you know~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Go lap up that taste yourself, then. I don’t wanna bother getting used to it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Don’t be so sour~ I got something sweet for the both of you this time, so give it a try for my sake, please~?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: You mean the… muckhairytoe or something?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Mhm. That’s the one~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s actually called macchiato, though…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …Whatever, it’s all the same to me. That one was edible, I’ll admit.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I wasn’t a huge fan of it, though. The flavor of caramel was too strong for my liking…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Thus I’ve prepared a cup of Vienna this time~ This’ll suit you better.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Thanks for being considerate, but… why do you keep recommending us coffee, anyway?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Well, you see~ I thought it’d be nice to make at least one friend who understands the savors of coffee, y’know?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I mean, I could drink coffee with you if you’re so desperate for a café buddy. You just seemed weirdly insistent with Gebura.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I gotta wonder what’s up with that.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Well… How should I put it?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: See, the thing about Gebura is that…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Her reactions are fun to watch?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: What?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The air’s taken a sharp turn to be menacing… I was just kidding~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I mean, it’s nice that we can gather round from time to time for a drink, isn’t it~?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: There’s no better reason than a hot cup of joe to bring us all together and chill~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s true, we’d usually be shut up in our own floors doing our jobs if it weren’t for breaks like this…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: If that’s what this is for, there’s no reason to make it about coffee, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Maybe he doesn’t have any other excuses?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You hit the bullseye there, Tiph~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Forget it. In that case, I could just come up here with Tiphereth to hang out more often.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I don’t think we’re that friendly with each other…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But still, it seems silly to me that you’re trying to make up reasons for us to meet, when all you needed to do was ask.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m honored to hear that~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: So, back to this coffee… Wanna give it a try?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: No reason to refuse a cup you prepared for me!

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Philosophy

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You seem rather quiet here.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: What more needs to be said? My role is only to observe.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: To observe, is it…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Indeed so. Some would think that this is merely a form of neglect. I see that you are one of them.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I was simply curious. We haven’t had many opportunities to talk with one another.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: There were practically none, were there? Neither you nor I left our respective posts.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Yet now you have the time to visit me of all people for a chat… It must indicate that we are freer than before, able to spare more of our moments.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Do you not welcome this change?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: I’m not quite certain of my sentiments.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Regardless… Have a warm cup of tea, now that you are here.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …If you’d be so kind.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Say, have you never tried other types of tea? It appears as though black is all you drink.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Maybe so. There are enough variants of black tea that I have not bothered in attempting to imbibe other beverages.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Ah, although the azure-maned noble boy insists around the clock that I partake of coffee.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: It is certainly true that there has been much change. I wouldn’t have expected that he would approach you first to recommend coffee.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: One day, perchance, all of us will come together.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Indeed… It will be quite different from the first time such a gathering took place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I must wonder if the day shall come when we all will engage in casual conversation and share trivial tales. I am rather doubtful of it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Yet deep down, you are looking forward to it. Perhaps everyone shares the same feelings.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I’ve finished my cup, so I’ll be taking my leave now. I appreciate the hospitality.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Rendezvous anytime. Tea will always be ready and waiting.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Philosophy

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: I must wonder how you two perceive me, now that your memories have returned in whole.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: What? That kind of stuff doesn’t matter to me anymore.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: You are much more self-possessed than I expected.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I can’t say I’m not at all uncomfortable, but we’re basically in the same oven now.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Come on, Hod, have some confidence. You look even smaller than usual…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: She’s not the person you remember in your past, at least not anymore. I can’t guarantee what’ll happen in the future, but she won’t be harming us for a good while.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Oh… Umm. Right…! Sorry, Gebura.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Fascinating. As much as it would be amusing to make a jest of her pitiable state…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Gebura is speaking the truth. I am no longer the being you interacted with in the past.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: When it seems to have ended, a new breath of life is given… Of course, I am not entirely separable from my past self, either.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: I have become someone who cannot do any harm to you, yet I can still see fear in your eyes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: What is it that you are so afraid of, child. I am in the same circumstances as yours now.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: I was just… nervous, since this is our first time sitting face to face and talking to each other.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Fret not. I have called you two for a simple reason… To have tea together.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: I suggest you drink it before it gets cold. It is best enjoyed while the scent is warm and able to be savored.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: The tea is clear… It tastes a bit sweet.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: I added lemon juice and honey to the black tea. I prepared it specially for you.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: It didn’t smell like honey at all, I thought you put sugar.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: It is because the scent of the honey was lost as it came in contact with the tea.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Too much sugar can make the tea feel muddy. Though I suppose it is a matter of preference.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …It sure is sweet. Not too bad.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Did you know? Black tea has several names across various regions.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Oh… I think I heard about that. Some call it “black tea” based on the color of the leaves, and some call it “red tea” since the color of the tea is red.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I guess it’s the difference between valuing the essence and the results.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Perhaps you could view it that way.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: So, let me ask how would you like to refer to this tea.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: …That’s a tough question.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: What’s the big deal? Just call it whichever name you’re more used to.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: If that is what you say.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: It is rather entertaining to converse with you. Come again later when you long for the scent of tea.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Natural Sciences

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: “Origin of the Elements”… “Effective nuclear charge”…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Ah, is this the right shelf?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s the one. Sort the books in order, please.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: This one goes here… Malkuth? Could you bring me that book over there?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Got it! There are lots of difficult-looking books here~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: …Why are we on this floor to help with work like this.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What other option do I have! I suddenly got a huge pile of books to organize, and the only vacant shelves are high up there…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But, getting up there with the books… is a tough task to do on my own.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I usually get help from Chesed and Gebura, but they both seemed busy today.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And Roland is nowhere to be seen. Where did that beanpole go!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Oh, I saw Roland go upstairs some time ago, in fact.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: He must’ve had some business there, I guess…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: We looked like we had a lot of free time to you, huh…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Get a grip, Netzach! Tiphereth approached us to ask for help for the first time, you know?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: She rarely came over to the Upper Layer back in the days, so it was hard for me to see her. I’m actually happy she came to us this time, you know?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Yeah, your department was at the very top, so you must have had even fewer chances to see her.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Right. We were occupied with our work, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What is keeping the two Patron Librarians on the floors above busy at the moment, anyway?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You know how Chesed is. Librarians from other floors drop by to enjoy his coffee all the time, and he’s always happy to oblige…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: And Gebura’s been sitting still with her eyes closed for some time. I’m not sure if she’s sleeping or meditating.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Gebura’s been meditating often ever since she woke up here. Maybe she’s got lots of stuff to think about?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Maybe. I’d feel bad for invading her private moments too many times just to ask for help with errands…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s not like I’m ignoring you or anything! You don’t… have to help if you don’t wanna.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Don’t you worry. Netzach may be a bellyacher, but he’s not hesitant to lend a hand.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’re certainly dealing with books on advanced subject matter as Roland said. Some are quite difficult to comprehend, even for me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What was that? Are you treating me like a child like that beanpole did?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I did not intend to belittle you. It’s only…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: You’re worried that I might have a real hard time trying to understand all these, right? I never had proper education, unlike you all.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Yes, that is the case. I did not mean to pity you, but… are you really okay with this?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I kinda am upset, if you ask me. And the question could be taken as mockery, if I wanted to take it that way.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I can brush it off because I know you’re not the kind of person to throw jabs at me, Yesod.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Really? I thought you hated all of us equally?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: The Upper Layer Syndrome…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Look, I’m sorry about that! I was immature back then… And I thought my opinions were always right.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: But not anymore. I’m still good at what I do, but now I admit that you aren’t half bad, either.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That doesn’t mean I want to be on friendlier terms with you all to make up for the past, don’t get me wrong!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: All I ask is that you don’t feel so pressured about your relationships with me. We’re fine the way it is now.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: You must have changed your way of thinking quite a bit.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Hmph, it’s a perk of being more mature.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Anyway… I didn’t take offense at what you said, Yesod.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m actually glad that you seem to get how hard I’m trying, if you ask me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m the one who read all the books here, figured out what they’re about, and labeled them, after all.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: You’re very positive, aren’t you?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m not. I would’ve been furious if someone else asked that.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …Alright, this is the last one for now. And…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Thanks for the help, guys.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Art

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: What could you be musing on, intoxicated all by your lonesome?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …You don’t seem to be in the mood for conversation.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: I don’t really feel like treating you nicely…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Are you upset about your alone time being interfered, or is it the shackles of the past that bind you?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Both, I guess. I dislike both.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: I’m denied something of my own, then and now.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: But… I do enjoy having drinks with others sometimes.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: On the premise that I am not among those “others”?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: I’m just saying that I’m not totally against it.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: …I don’t think you’ll bite, but lemme ask out of courtesy. Wanna have a drink?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You do know what my answer would be. As you suspected, I don’t quite feel like having a beverage.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: What’re you here for, then. There’s nothing else to see here.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: …Let’s say that I have been visiting others to introduce myself.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: You’re not like before.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Perhaps I am experiencing changes, as nobody is ever truly immutable.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Yes. Speaking of… It would seem that most of the Patron Librarians have collected their thoughts and made up their minds.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: What about you?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: I dunno yet. I’m scared of decidedly setting my mind on something, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: If what I chose turns out to be an untruthful answer… I wouldn’t know what to do.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: No man can choose the right path at all times. One only has to believe that the path they are taking is the right one.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Such is the nature of truth; it is akin to faith.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: The paths you have chosen, where you stand at the moment… All that you’ve seen, heard, and touched for yourself constitute the road to truth.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: You need to carry the faith that you’re headed for truth.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: …Thanks for the nice words, whatever that was about.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Though what you’re saying is all too hard for me to wrap my head around. It’s always been.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Did you make up your mind at least?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: Maybe so, maybe no. Peradventure I will express my thoughts when everyone has formed an opinion.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I suppose I shouldn’t waste any more of your time. It was a short, yet enjoyable conversation.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Art

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Hey, Netzach~ We’ve got a question…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Oh? Gebura and Roland are here, too~ What are you guys doing all about like this?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: It’s obvious. They’re all slacking off. And what’s all this… Alcohol?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Get it together! Look what mess that hopeless drunkard created!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Sup, Tiphereth.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m not in the mood to greet you back! I’m sure Angela won’t like it when this reaches her ears, hm?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She brought us to the book that one time, true…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: I was having a light chat with Netzach, then this black suit snuck in.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hngh… I was just here for a drink, that’s it…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, did you all make an appointment to meet here or somethin’? That’s a lot of folks coming to this floor at once. Aren’t you popular, Netz~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’d never be up for drinking meetings! Especially if it’s with Netzach!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m here because Tiphereth said she had something she wanted to ask~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Then just ask the question and go…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Like you’d give a coherent answer in that state! Forget it. I’ll just ask another time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Gosh, the stench of alcohol is everywhere… Stop drinking so much, even the books will stink at this rate!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: …That hurts. Stop hitting.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Oh no, Gebura~ You shouldn’t smoke in a place like this~ Other librarians are walking by~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Chesed is right! Smoking on top of books is a bad idea. This spot is full of wood!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I dunno if the books can catch fire here, but it doesn’t look very good.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: …Okay.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She seems to be more open to Tiph’s words than yours.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I’m used to it~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Hey, it’s not like we get to gather up like this often… Why don’t you guys have some drinks before you leave?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Ugh, you’re so wearisome! You’re never, ever gonna see me drinking with you!!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I was just starting to warm up to you, but now I’m starting to take a dislike again. Maybe replacing you really was the best option!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: Harsh words, man…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Don’t mind it too much, Netzie~ She doesn’t sincerely mean it~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We have things left to do upstairs. Thanks for the offer, but no thanks~

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can hear you shouting from all the way downstairs.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What is this ruckus about?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Er, nothing much, just, reinforcing our bonds.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: …That’s why there are beer cans all over the floor.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hahaa…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: What are you two doing together?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was asked to find a book he needs.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I figured that a book on the Floor of Language would make good supplementary material, so we were heading up.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Oh, that so? Guess I should vamoose. Appreciate the drinks, Netzach. The story you told was interesting, too.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: So, Yesod. What’s the book you want?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Art
Dialog.Content: She didn’t scold us this time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Oh I’d have loved to see that…

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Religion

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Here’s the books you asked for.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: Hey Tiphy! Hey Roland! What brought you two here?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nothing big. These books seemed a bit too heavy for her to carry on her own. Though… I’m already bringing a whole lotta books here myself. What more does this old man want…?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: That’s not exactly the most appropriate thing to say in front of the person to whom you’re referring, is it, sir?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …And since when did you start addressing me so politely?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I simply desire to read many books. I would rather not spend my time in complete idleness.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Let’s see… What books did our resident geriatric want to read so much that he’d ask Tiphereth to pick ‘em?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: “Continuity of Life”… “Bioengineering Technologies”… Boy, this is straight out of a biology shelf.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: He’d gone through chemistry the other day.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I wouldn’t have made you go through the trouble had I known that you would bring this many books… I owe much gratitude to you for your continued assistance, young miss.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I did think about asking for help… But Roland came over and lent his hand, so I chose not to.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I didn’t really expect you to ask for stuff like this, Mister Hokma. I thought you would know all this already.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Religion
Dialog.Content: I am reading them multiple times so that the knowledge won’t be lost from my memory.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: One read is never enough. Especially when you are a learner.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I see what you mean. The same sentence can give off different impressions every time you read it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Mmh… Cultured people talking cultured things I don’t get.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyhoo, what were you guys doing here?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Little more than insignificant chatter which is related to the work we do in this place.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: That’s what we were up to. As you indulge in work, you pile up all kinds of feelings!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Does that mean you were mouthing off about your boss?!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Listen, Angela may pretend not to, but she sees everything going on in the Library… Even now, she might be overhearing this very conversation.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And then she’d show up like she saw nothing and…

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Nat. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Aren’t you the one talking about your boss behind her back?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: We were mostly chatting about receiving guests. Hmm… Oh right, Yesod complained about Angela, too!

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Malkuth, don’t say anything that could cause confusion.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: My complaint was simply about the stacks of books remaining in the corridors which are making a disordered sight.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - History
Dialog.Content: I mean, you’re basically saying that you don’t like how untidy the Library is, right?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Tech. Sciences
Dialog.Content: The responsibility for that lies on all of us. I wasn’t targeting Angela in particular.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Still, great efforts are being exerted to constantly receive a variety of guests, and that is worthy of praise in itself.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: That extends to you folk as well.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, I’ve gotten pretty used to it by now, so it’s no biggie really.

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Library – Floor of Philosophy

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Sorry, but coffee is still the king of all drinks~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: It is quite a shame to know that such is the pitiable hill you choose to die on. Perhaps your tongue has been paralyzed by the overbearingly thick, strong flavor and scent.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m not sure if I’m in a library or a café.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Oh, it’s Angela. What are you doing here?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I was just meandering around using the bit of free time I have.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What about you lot, then? Are you engaging in a book discussion or whatever?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: While that activity piques my interest as well… At the moment, we are having a friendly chat between Patron Librarians.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: We were kinda dragged here by her assistants, though~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: It is regrettable that you put it that way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The assistant librarians?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Mmhmm~ They sometimes visit my floor for a cup of coffee. Not many other floors make it a habit to enjoy fine beverages.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I was having some coffee with Hod and Gebura~ Then they suddenly brought us here, saying they’d like to return the favor. Isn’t that a surprise?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: Should’ve realized that they were hers from the color of their attire…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sounds like you’re on friendly terms with assistant librarians.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Language
Dialog.Content: They’re our coworkers, no need to be cold with them.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: That’s right~ By the way, Angela, do you have a minute?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Maybe. Why do you ask?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: I was wondering if you could stick around for a cup of tea.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Since you’re here, why don’t you help yourself~? No coffee, though; I only brought mine.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: We don’t get to talk with you like this often.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Fine, I’ll accept your offer.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The other assistant librarians are having tea as well.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: Do not be too harsh on them. Refreshments such as these are a necessity from time to time.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Philosophy
Dialog.Content: They are all busy workers, racing to get their jobs done.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Well, even though we’re here together, that doesn’t mean we’re all that comfortable with each other~

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Still, I think it’s amazing that we can gather round and face each other in the first place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …It’s unfortunate that I can’t taste or smell the tea you troubled to prepare for me.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Soaking up this atmosphere is nice enough, I think?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Though, as great as it’d be to be able to enjoy it together next time~

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Anyway, thank you for the conversation. I’ll be going now.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: Come over to my floor sometime~ Roland is an occasional visitor, so feel free to bring him with you if you don’t feel like coming on your own~

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ll consider it if I get any free time later.

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Literature
Dialog.Content: Will Angela make another visit?

Dialog.Title: Patron Librarian - Soc. Sciences
Dialog.Content: My hunch leans toward yes~
